thread.title: 4 people, including a 16-year-old girl, arrested on suspicion of planning Paris suicide attack
thread.title_full: 4 people, including a 16-year-old girl, arrested on suspicion of planning Paris suicide attack

author: Barbara Tasch
title: 4 people, including a 16-year-old girl, arrested on suspicion of planning Paris suicide attack
text:
print 
A French gendarme officer patrols in front of the Arc de Triomphe, on the Champs Elysees, in Paris, Monday Nov. 23, 2015. AP Photo/Laurent Ciprian 
Four people, including a 16-year-old girl, have been arrested in the south of France on suspicion of planning an attack in the French capital, Paris prosecutor's office said . 
The four people were arrested in Montpellier on Friday morning by anti-terror investigators, M6 reports. 
They were allegedly planning an attack with a suicide belt in a tourist hotspot in the French capital. 
A teenage girl, who was supposed to serve as a "bait" before detonating a suicide belt, was arrested. 
Her 21-year-old boyfriend was also arrested, both were reportedly known by the authorities for their connections with radical Islam and wish to travel to Syria. The other two suspects were 27 and 34. 
Police discovered 71 grams of TATP, a powerful explosive — used during the November 13 Paris attacks and March 22 Brussels attack — when they raided the suspects' homes. The explosive is reportedly favoured by ISIS, but there is no evidence yet that the terror group is behind this latest plot. 
They also found a laboratory set up to make the substance as well as one litre of acetone, hydrogen peroxide, and one litre of sulfuric acid — the three ingredients needed to make the explosive, BFMTV reports . 
The arrest reportedly follows investigation on social media, which allowed the police to identify the four suspects. 
More than 230 people have died in France in a series of Islamist militant attacks since the beginning of 2015. The country has been under a state of emergency rules since the November 2015 attacks that killed 130 people and injured hundreds more.
